args: Er, Ilia? Did I perhaps do something\nto offend Mordecai?
I don't think so. Why do you ask?
Because lately he has been very busy\nsimply...staring at me.
Why are you watching Meene, bud?
Do, uh...do you have a thing for her?
Meene's wings are very pretty.\nI want to look at them all the time.
Oh, THAT'S what you meant. Whew!\nI thought you had a crush or something.
Actually, don't worry about it.\nDo you like pretty things, Mordecai?
Oh, yes. Meene, can I take off your wings\nso I can see them more closely?
Oh. Then can Ilia make faerie wings\nwith alchemy?
Hmmm... Synthesizing faerie wings\nsounds like an interesting challenge,\nhonestly. Mind if I look into it, Meene?
Don't YOU start in with the crazy talk!
Ha ha ha! Sorry. I was only kidding.
You know, Mordecai, there are lots of\npretty things besides faerie wings.
Really. Here, lemme show you.\nCome with me, everybody!
Yeah, this lake is one of my favorite\nhang-out spots. Super pretty, right?
A lakeside picnic is a wonderful idea!
Does water always light up like this?
That isn't the water lighting up, actually:\nIt's sunlight reflecting off the surface.
That's right. When light touches a surface,\nit bounces and scatters in a bunch of\ndifferent directions.
And THAT is what makes this scene\nso beautiful! Pretty cool stuff, huh?
Ah! Ilia! Was that a faerie in the sky?
In the sky...? Oh! No, that wasn't a faerie.\nThat's an animal called a bird.
Birds fly in the sky like faeries?
That's right. They have wings just like\nfaeries that let them fly.
Hmm... Maybe I should have synthesized\na body with some wings attached to it.
A good parent knows not to spoil her child.
Hee hee! ...Hmm? Oh dear!\nThe mana flow is starting to warp!
Whew! The sound was pretty far off.\nAnd since it was just once, it was probably\njust a test round.
Still, it gave me quite a start. Why would\nthe army be doing training exercises here?
Ilia, let's go to the sound right now!
The bird fell down. We have to help.
...Looks like the soldiers have cleared out.
If someone from the army saw us, it would\nget...complicated. Let's look for that bird.\nYou're worried about it, aren't you?
Yes. I hope it isn't hurt.
It's badly injured... I shall treat it at once.
That's a wound from a manacaster.\nIt must have gotten caught up\nin the military exercise.
'Cause us humans are fighting a war\nwith the dragons at the moment.
Yeah, war. It means killing each other.
Because the civilization the humans\nhave built is eating away at dragonkind.
And humans would rather fight than\nsurrender what they have made.
Both sides are fighting for their survival,\nand the ripples from that fight keep\nreaching further and further out.
This war is between humans and dragons?
Then why was the bird shot?
I'm afraid that's how war is, buddy.
Once it breaks out, everything around it\ngets swept up in the fighting.
Heck, this whole beautiful scene around us\ncould all get turned to ash soon.
That isn't fair. It's too sad.
Yeah, it's an ugly truth for sure, but that's\nwhat's happening right now.
I wish the world were full of nothing but\npretty things, but it's not, and it sucks.
Fit as a fiddle, this one.
Thank you, Zethia. I'm very glad.
This world isn't just pretty things...
